docs.title: cifti-convert
docs.description:
Dump cifti matrix into other formats.

This command is used to convert a full CIFTI matrix to/from formats that can be used by programs that don't understand CIFTI.  You must specify exactly one of -to-gifti-ext, -from-gifti-ext, -to-nifti, -from-nifti, -to-text, or -from-text.

If you want to write an existing CIFTI file with a different CIFTI version, see -file-convert, and its -cifti-version-convert option.

If you want part of the CIFTI file as a metric, label, or volume file, see -cifti-separate.  If you want to create a CIFTI file from metric and/or volume files, see the -cifti-create-* commands.

If you want to import a matrix that is restricted to an ROI, first create a template CIFTI file matching that ROI using a -cifti-create-* command.  After importing to CIFTI, you can then expand the file into a standard brainordinates space with -cifti-create-dense-from-template.  If you want to export only part of a CIFTI file, first create an roi-restricted CIFTI file with -cifti-restrict-dense-mapping.

The -transpose option to -from-gifti-ext is needed if the replacement binary file is in column-major order.

The -unit options accept these values:

SECOND
HERTZ
METER
RADIAN

docs.title: to_gifti_ext
docs.description: convert to GIFTI external binary

docs.title: cifti_in
docs.description: the input cifti file

docs.title: gifti_out
docs.description: output - the output gifti file

docs.title: to_gifti_ext
docs.description: convert to GIFTI external binary

docs.title: cifti_out
docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.title: from_gifti_ext
docs.description: convert a GIFTI made with this command back into a CIFTI

docs.title: gifti_in
docs.description: the input gifti file

docs.title: cifti_out
docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.title: reset_timepoints
docs.description: reset the mapping along rows to timepoints, taking length from the gifti file

docs.title: timestep
docs.description: the desired time between frames

docs.title: timestart
docs.description: the desired time offset of the initial frame

docs.title: opt_unit_unit
docs.description: use a unit other than time: unit identifier (default SECOND)

docs.title: reset_timepoints
docs.description: reset the mapping along rows to timepoints, taking length from the gifti file

docs.title: opt_reset_scalars
docs.description: reset mapping along rows to scalars, taking length from the gifti file

docs.title: opt_column_reset_scalars
docs.description: reset mapping along columns to scalar (useful for changing number of series in a sdseries file)

docs.title: replace_binary
docs.description: replace data with a binary file

docs.title: binary_in
docs.description: the binary file that contains replacement data

docs.title: opt_flip_endian
docs.description: byteswap the binary file

docs.title: opt_transpose
docs.description: transpose the binary file

docs.title: replace_binary
docs.description: replace data with a binary file

docs.title: from_gifti_ext
docs.description: convert a GIFTI made with this command back into a CIFTI

docs.title: nifti_out
docs.description: the output nifti file

docs.title: to_nifti
docs.description: convert to NIFTI1

docs.title: cifti_in
docs.description: the input cifti file

docs.title: nifti_out
docs.description: the output nifti file

docs.title: opt_smaller_file
docs.description: use better-fitting dimension lengths

docs.title: opt_smaller_dims
docs.description: minimize the largest dimension, for tools that don't like large indices

docs.title: to_nifti
docs.description: convert to NIFTI1

docs.title: cifti_out
docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.title: from_nifti
docs.description: convert a NIFTI (1 or 2) file made with this command back into CIFTI

docs.title: nifti_in
docs.description: the input nifti file

docs.title: cifti_template
docs.description: a cifti file with the dimension(s) and mapping(s) that should be used

docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.description: reset the mapping along rows to timepoints, taking length from the nifti file

docs.description: the desired time between frames

docs.description: the desired time offset of the initial frame

docs.description: use a unit other than time: unit identifier (default SECOND)

docs.title: to_text
docs.description: convert to a plain text file

docs.title: cifti_in
docs.description: the input cifti file

docs.title: text_out
docs.description: output - the output text file

docs.title: opt_col_delim_delim_string
docs.description: choose string to put between elements in a row: the string to use (default is a tab character)

docs.title: to_text
docs.description: convert to a plain text file

docs.title: cifti_out
docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.title: from_text
docs.description: convert from plain text to cifti

docs.title: text_in
docs.description: the input text file

docs.title: cifti_template
docs.description: a cifti file with the dimension(s) and mapping(s) that should be used

docs.title: cifti_out
docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.title: opt_col_delim_delim_string
docs.description: specify string that is between elements in a row: the string to use (default is any whitespace)

docs.title: reset_timepoints
docs.description: reset the mapping along rows to timepoints, taking length from the text file

docs.title: timestep
docs.description: the desired time between frames

docs.title: timestart
docs.description: the desired time offset of the initial frame

docs.title: opt_unit_unit
docs.description: use a unit other than time: unit identifier (default SECOND)

docs.title: reset_timepoints
docs.description: reset the mapping along rows to timepoints, taking length from the text file

docs.title: opt_reset_scalars
docs.description: reset mapping along rows to scalars, taking length from the text file

docs.title: from_text
docs.description: convert from plain text to cifti
